If the sales price53 equals book value, there is no gain or loss, because a cash inflow equal to book value is the exchange of one asset for another of equal recorded value and therefore not a net inflow of resources.
Therefore, the amount of cash inflow equal to book value is not recognized as a revenue, a gain, or an other financing source.
Therefore, the amount of cash inflow equal to book value is not recognized as a revenue, a gain, or an other financing source.
The amount of cash flow equal to book value is an exchange of one asset for another of equal recorded value and therefore is not recognized as a gain, a revenue, or an other financing source.
